content.description: Laydown start on a heavily chalked edge/slot.  Pull on and move up to a big square edge, then make a long move left into the flake of Easy Overlooker.
content.location: Right side of the boulder, just right of the downclimb tree.  Look for a low, chalky edge.

content.description: A spectacular climb.  Start on the jug shelf and follow the seam out the massive roof to a jug.  Turn the corner, and save a little energy for one last move to the lip.
content.protection: 6+ pads. Not particularly tall, but needs a lot of pads or people to shuffle them as you make your way out the roof.  A spotter for the end is good too, because a fall off the pads would not be good.
content.location: Huge roof on the left side of the boulder.  Can't miss it.

content.description: Classic compression problem. Sit-start on a lefthand pinch/sidepull and righthand crimp, and move up and left through a crazy series of tiered blocky pinches, aretes, and heelhooks. Stand-start is v5.
content.location: This is on the Mellifluous Boulder. As you're walking along the Endless cliffline at Fern Point, look for a pretty obvious trail leading away from the cliff in the vicinity of Mellifluous/Prowess area. This leads very quickly down the hill to an impressive satellite-shaped boulder that is perched on the edge of a cliffband. Geometric Equation if the farthest right/downstream line on the boulder, starting just left of a small tree, and on the edge of the cliff.

content.description: Sit down start behind the tree on a juggy left hand side pull, and decent right hand edge.  Climb up and right into the flake feature, trying hard to avoid the tree.  Might be a 3 star climb if the tree weren't there, but fun nonetheless.
content.location: In the middle of the boulder, behind the down climb tree.
